intro: Synaphea petiolaris, commonly known as the petiole synaphea, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. Synaphea petiolaris is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
